translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Kuṭaja Flower Birth Stories
The Elder Ekacārī’s Birth Story
“In the Tāvatiṃsa realm of the gods,
a great sound arose then:
‘The Buddha has appeared in the world,
and we are full of passion.’
For those who had become anxious,
who were full of the dart of sorrow,
I was supported by Sabalā,
and I went into the Buddha’s presence.
Taking a coral tree flower,
I created a song,
and at the time of the Buddha’s final extinguishment,
I offered it to the Buddha.
All the gods rejoiced,
and at that time sugar cane grew for me.
For a hundred thousand eons,
I did not fall into the lower realms.
For sixty thousand eons,
from then until now, sixteen people
known as the Great Champions,
were powerful Universal Monarchs.
The four analytical insights …
… the Buddha’s instruction has been fulfilled.”🔽Thus the elder Ekacārī recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā ekacāriyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Ekacāriyattherassāpadānaṁ navamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmai ekacāriyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽ekacāriya therassa apadānam navama
translated: The Elder Ekacārī’s Birth Story, the ninth.
